00021 /*! \file
00022  * \brief Asterisk module definitions.
00023  *
00024  * This file contains the definitons for functions Asterisk modules should
00025  * provide and some other module related functions.
00026  */
00027

00029 #define _ASTERISK_MODULE_H

00051 #define AST_MODULE_CONFIG "modules.conf" /*!< \brief Module configuration file */
00052 
00053 enum ast_module_unload_mode {
00054    AST_FORCE_SOFT = 0, /*!< Softly unload a module, only if not in use */
00055    AST_FORCE_FIRM = 1, /*!< Firmly unload a module, even if in use */
00056    AST_FORCE_HARD = 2, /*!< as FIRM, plus dlclose() on the module. Not recommended
00057             as it may cause crashes */
00058 };
00059 
00060 enum ast_module_load_result {
00061    AST_MODULE_LOAD_SUCCESS = 0,    /*!< Module loaded and configured */
00062    AST_MODULE_LOAD_DECLINE = 1,    /*!< Module is not configured */
00063    AST_MODULE_LOAD_SKIP = 2,       /*!< Module was skipped for some reason */
00064    AST_MODULE_LOAD_PRIORITY = 3,   /*!< Module is not loaded yet, but is added to prioity heap */
00065    AST_MODULE_LOAD_FAILURE = -1,   /*!< Module could not be loaded properly */
00066 };
00067 
00068 /*! 
00069  * \brief Load a module.
00070  * \param resource_name The name of the module to load.
00071  *
00072  * This function is run by the PBX to load the modules.  It performs
00073  * all loading and initialization tasks.   Basically, to load a module, just
00074  * give it the name of the module and it will do the rest.
00075  *
00076  * \return See possible enum values for ast_module_load_result.
00077  */
00078 enum ast_module_load_result ast_load_resource(const char *resource_name);
00079 
00080 /*! 
00081  * \brief Unload a module.
00082  * \param resource_name The name of the module to unload.
00083  * \param ast_module_unload_mode The force flag. This should be set using one of the AST_FORCE flags.
00084  *
00085  * This function unloads a module.  It will only unload modules that are not in
00086  * use (usecount not zero), unless #AST_FORCE_FIRM or #AST_FORCE_HARD is 
00087  * specified.  Setting #AST_FORCE_FIRM or #AST_FORCE_HARD will unload the
00088  * module regardless of consequences (NOT RECOMMENDED).
00089  *
00090  * \retval 0 on success.
00091  * \retval -1 on error.
00092  */
00093 int ast_unload_resource(const char *resource_name, enum ast_module_unload_mode);
00094 
00095 /*! 
00096  * \brief Notify when usecount has been changed.
00097  *
00098  * This function calulates use counts and notifies anyone trying to keep track
00099  * of them.  It should be called whenever your module's usecount changes.
00100  *
00101  * \note The ast_module_user_* functions take care of calling this function for you.
00102  */
00103 void ast_update_use_count(void);
00104 
00105 /*! 
00106  * \brief Ask for a list of modules, descriptions, and use counts.
00107  * \param modentry A callback to an updater function.
00108  * \param like
00109  *
00110  * For each of the modules loaded, modentry will be executed with the resource,
00111  * description, and usecount values of each particular module.
00112  * 
00113  * \return the number of modules loaded
00114  */
00115 int ast_update_module_list(int (*modentry)(const char *module, const char *description, int usecnt, const char *like),
00116             const char *like);
00117 
00118 /*!
00119  * \brief Check if module with the name given is loaded
00120  * \param name Module name, like "chan_sip.so"
00121  * \retval 1 if true 
00122  * \retval 0 if false
00123  */
00124 int ast_module_check(const char *name);
00125 
00126 /*! 
00127  * \brief Add a procedure to be run when modules have been updated.
00128  * \param updater The function to run when modules have been updated.
00129  *
00130  * This function adds the given function to a linked list of functions to be
00131  * run when the modules are updated. 
00132  *
00133  * \retval 0 on success 
00134  * \retval -1 on failure.
00135  */
00136 int ast_loader_register(int (*updater)(void));
00137 
00138 /*! 
00139  * \brief Remove a procedure to be run when modules are updated.
00140  * \param updater The updater function to unregister.
00141  *
00142  * This removes the given function from the updater list.
00143  * 
00144  * \retval 0 on success
00145  * \retval -1 on failure.
00146  */
00147 int ast_loader_unregister(int (*updater)(void));
00148 
00149 /*!
00150  * \brief Run the unload() callback for all loaded modules
00151  *
00152  * This function should be called when Asterisk is shutting down gracefully.
00153  */
00154 void ast_module_shutdown(void);
00155 
00156 /*! 
00157  * \brief Match modules names for the Asterisk cli.
00158  * \param line Unused by this function, but this should be the line we are
00159  *        matching.
00160  * \param word The partial name to match. 
00161  * \param pos The position the word we are completing is in.
00162  * \param state The possible match to return.
00163  * \param rpos The position we should be matching.  This should be the same as
00164  *        pos.
00165  * \param needsreload This should be 1 if we need to reload this module and 0
00166  *        otherwise.  This function will only return modules that are reloadble
00167  *        if this is 1.
00168  *
00169  * \retval A possible completion of the partial match.
00170  * \retval NULL if no matches were found.
00171  */
00172 char *ast_module_helper(const char *line, const char *word, int pos, int state, int rpos, int needsreload);

00174 /* Opaque type for module handles generated by the loader */
00175 
00176 struct ast_module;
00177 
00178 /* User count routines keep track of which channels are using a given module
00179    resource.  They can help make removing modules safer, particularly if
00180    they're in use at the time they have been requested to be removed */
00181 
00182 struct ast_module_user;
00183 struct ast_module_user_list;
00184 
00185 /*! \page ModMngmnt The Asterisk Module management interface
00186  *
00187  * All modules must implement the module API (load, unload...)
00188  */
00189 
00190 enum ast_module_flags {
00191    AST_MODFLAG_DEFAULT = 0,
00192    AST_MODFLAG_GLOBAL_SYMBOLS = (1 << 0),
00193    AST_MODFLAG_LOAD_ORDER = (1 << 1),
00194 };
00195 
00196 struct ast_module_info {
00197 
00198    /*!
00199     * The 'self' pointer for a module; it will be set by the loader before
00200     * it calls the module's load_module() entrypoint, and used by various
00201     * other macros that need to identify the module.
00202     */
00203 
00204    struct ast_module *self;
00205    enum ast_module_load_result (*load)(void);   /*!< register stuff etc. Optional. */
00206    int (*reload)(void);       /*!< config etc. Optional. */
00207    int (*unload)(void);       /*!< unload. called with the module locked */
00208    int (*backup_globals)(void);     /*!< for embedded modules, backup global data */
00209    void (*restore_globals)(void);      /*!< for embedded modules, restore global data */
00210    const char *name;       /*!< name of the module for loader reference and CLI commands */
00211    const char *description;      /*!< user friendly description of the module. */
00212 
00213    /*! 
00214     * This holds the ASTERISK_GPL_KEY, signifiying that you agree to the terms of
00215     * the Asterisk license as stated in the ASTERISK_GPL_KEY.  Your module will not
00216     * load if it does not return the EXACT key string.
00217     */
00218 
00219    const char *key;
00220    unsigned int flags;
00221 
00222    /*! The value of AST_BUILDOPT_SUM when this module was compiled */
00223    const char buildopt_sum[33];
00224 
00225    /*! This value represents the order in which a module's load() function is initialized.
00226     *  The lower this value, the higher the priority.  The value is only checked if the
00227     *  AST_MODFLAG_LOAD_ORDER flag is set.  If the AST_MODFLAG_LOAD_ORDER flag is not set,
00228     *  this value will never be read and the module will be given the lowest possible priority
00229     *  on load. */
00230    unsigned char load_pri;
00231 };
00232 
00233 void ast_module_register(const struct ast_module_info *);
00234 void ast_module_unregister(const struct ast_module_info *);
00235 
00236 struct ast_module_user *__ast_module_user_add(struct ast_module *, struct ast_channel *);
00237 void __ast_module_user_remove(struct ast_module *, struct ast_module_user *);
00238 void __ast_module_user_hangup_all(struct ast_module *);
00239 
00240 #define ast_module_user_add(chan) __ast_module_user_add(ast_module_info->self, chan)
00241 #define ast_module_user_remove(user) __ast_module_user_remove(ast_module_info->self, user)
00242 #define ast_module_user_hangup_all() __ast_module_user_hangup_all(ast_module_info->self)
00243 
00244 struct ast_module *ast_module_ref(struct ast_module *);
00245 void ast_module_unref(struct ast_module *);

00247 #if defined(__cplusplus) || defined(c_plusplus)
00248 #define AST_MODULE_INFO(keystr, flags_to_set, desc, load_func, unload_func, reload_func)  \
00249    static struct ast_module_info __mod_info = { \
00250       NULL,             \
00251       load_func,           \
00252       reload_func,            \
00253       unload_func,            \
00254       NULL,             \
00255       NULL,             \
00256       AST_MODULE,          \
00257       desc,             \
00258       keystr,              \
00259       flags_to_set,           \
00260       AST_BUILDOPT_SUM,       \
00261    };                \
00262    static void  __attribute__((constructor)) __reg_module(void) \
00263    { \
00264       ast_module_register(&__mod_info); \
00265    } \
00266    static void  __attribute__((destructor)) __unreg_module(void) \
00267    { \
00268       ast_module_unregister(&__mod_info); \
00269    } \
00270    static const __attribute__((unused)) struct ast_module_info *ast_module_info = &__mod_info
00271 
00272 #define AST_MODULE_INFO_STANDARD(keystr, desc)     \
00273    AST_MODULE_INFO(keystr, AST_MODFLAG_DEFAULT, desc, \
00274          load_module,         \
00275          unload_module,    \
00276          NULL        \
00277              )
00278 #else /* plain C */
00279 
00280 /* forward declare this pointer in modules, so that macro/function
00281    calls that need it can get it, since it will actually be declared
00282    and populated at the end of the module's source file... */
00283 static const __attribute__((unused)) struct ast_module_info *ast_module_info;
00284 
00285 #if !defined(EMBEDDED_MODULE)
00286 #define __MODULE_INFO_SECTION
00287 #define __MODULE_INFO_GLOBALS
00288 #else
00289 /*
00290  * For embedded modules we need additional information to backup and
00291  * restore the global variables in the module itself, so we can unload
00292  * reload the module.
00293  * EMBEDDED_MODULE is defined as the module name, so the calls to make_var()
00294  * below will actually define different symbols for each module.
00295  */
00296 #define __MODULE_INFO_SECTION __attribute__((section(".embed_module")))
00297 #define __MODULE_INFO_GLOBALS .backup_globals = __backup_globals, .restore_globals = __restore_globals,
00298 
00299 #define make_var_sub(mod, type) __ ## mod ## _ ## type
00300 #define make_var(mod, type) make_var_sub(mod, type)
00301 
00302 extern void make_var(EMBEDDED_MODULE, bss_start);
00303 extern void make_var(EMBEDDED_MODULE, bss_end);
00304 extern void make_var(EMBEDDED_MODULE, data_start);
00305 extern void make_var(EMBEDDED_MODULE, data_end);
00306 
00307 static void * __attribute__((section(".embed_module"))) __global_backup;
00308 
00309 static int __backup_globals(void)
00310 {
00311    size_t data_size = & make_var(EMBEDDED_MODULE, data_end) - & make_var(EMBEDDED_MODULE, data_start);
00312 
00313    if (__global_backup)
00314       return 0;
00315 
00316    if (!data_size)
00317       return 0;
00318 
00319    if (!(__global_backup = ast_malloc(data_size)))
00320       return -1;
00321 
00322    memcpy(__global_backup, & make_var(EMBEDDED_MODULE, data_start), data_size);
00323 
00324    return 0;
00325 }
00326 
00327 static void __restore_globals(void)
00328 {
00329    size_t data_size = & make_var(EMBEDDED_MODULE, data_end) - & make_var(EMBEDDED_MODULE, data_start);
00330    size_t bss_size = & make_var(EMBEDDED_MODULE, bss_end) - & make_var(EMBEDDED_MODULE, bss_start);
00331 
00332    if (bss_size)
00333       memset(& make_var(EMBEDDED_MODULE, bss_start), 0, bss_size);
00334 
00335    if (!data_size || !__global_backup)
00336       return;
00337 
00338    memcpy(& make_var(EMBEDDED_MODULE, data_start), __global_backup, data_size);
00339 }
00340 #undef make_var
00341 #undef make_var_sub
00342 #endif /* EMBEDDED_MODULE */
00343 
00344 #define AST_MODULE_INFO(keystr, flags_to_set, desc, fields...) \
00345    static struct ast_module_info             \
00346       __MODULE_INFO_SECTION            \
00347       __mod_info = {             \
00348       __MODULE_INFO_GLOBALS            \
00349       .name = AST_MODULE,           \
00350       .flags = flags_to_set,           \
00351       .description = desc,          \
00352       .key = keystr,             \
00353       .buildopt_sum = AST_BUILDOPT_SUM,      \
00354       fields                  \
00355    };                   \
00356    static void  __attribute__((constructor)) __reg_module(void) \
00357    { \
00358       ast_module_register(&__mod_info); \
00359    } \
00360    static void  __attribute__((destructor)) __unreg_module(void) \
00361    { \
00362       ast_module_unregister(&__mod_info); \
00363    } \
00364    static const struct ast_module_info *ast_module_info = &__mod_info
00365 
00366 #define AST_MODULE_INFO_STANDARD(keystr, desc)     \
00367    AST_MODULE_INFO(keystr, AST_MODFLAG_DEFAULT, desc, \
00368          .load = load_module,       \
00369          .unload = unload_module,      \
00370              )
00371 #endif   /* plain C */
00372 
00373 /*! 
00374  * \brief Register an application.
00375  *
00376  * \param app Short name of the application
00377  * \param execute a function callback to execute the application. It should return
00378  *                non-zero if the channel needs to be hung up.
00379  * \param synopsis a short description (one line synopsis) of the application
00380  * \param description long description with all of the details about the use of 
00381  *                    the application
00382  * 
00383  * This registers an application with Asterisk's internal application list. 
00384  * \note The individual applications themselves are responsible for registering and unregistering
00385  *       and unregistering their own CLI commands.
00386  * 
00387  * \retval 0 success 
00388  * \retval -1 failure.
00389  */
00390 #define ast_register_application(app, execute, synopsis, description) ast_register_application2(app, execute, synopsis, description, ast_module_info->self)
00391 
00392 /*! 
00393  * \brief Register an application using XML documentation.
00394  *
00395  * \param app Short name of the application
00396  * \param execute a function callback to execute the application. It should return
00397  *                non-zero if the channel needs to be hung up.
00398  * 
00399  * This registers an application with Asterisk's internal application list. 
00400  * \note The individual applications themselves are responsible for registering and unregistering
00401  *       and unregistering their own CLI commands.
00402  * 
00403  * \retval 0 success 
00404  * \retval -1 failure.
00405  */
00406 #define ast_register_application_xml(app, execute) ast_register_application(app, execute, NULL, NULL)
00407 
00408 
00409 /*!
00410  * \brief Register an application.
00411  *
00412  * \param app Short name of the application
00413  * \param execute a function callback to execute the application. It should return
00414  *                non-zero if the channel needs to be hung up.
00415  * \param synopsis a short description (one line synopsis) of the application
00416  * \param description long description with all of the details about the use of
00417  *                    the application
00418  * \param mod module this application belongs to
00419  *
00420  * This registers an application with Asterisk's internal application list.
00421  * \note The individual applications themselves are responsible for registering and unregistering
00422  *       and unregistering their own CLI commands.
00423  *
00424  * \retval 0 success
00425  * \retval -1 failure.
00426  */
00427 int ast_register_application2(const char *app, int (*execute)(struct ast_channel *, void *),
00428                  const char *synopsis, const char *description, void *mod);
00429 
00430 /*! 
00431  * \brief Unregister an application
00432  * 
00433  * \param app name of the application (does not have to be the same string as the one that was registered)
00434  * 
00435  * This unregisters an application from Asterisk's internal application list.
00436  * 
00437  * \retval 0 success 
00438  * \retval -1 failure
00439  */
00440 int ast_unregister_application(const char *app);
